Patent Information.Patent Title: Hagfish cathelin-associated antimicrobial peptides and genes.
Patent Information.Abstract: The present invention includes Myxine glutinosa cathelin-associated antimicrobial peptides and genes encoding these peptides. The invention also includes compositions an methods for producing these peptides as well as method of preventing and treating microbial infections using these peptides.

Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Hematopoietic antimicrobial peptide-37 (MgCath37; hagfishes, chordates, animals)
Sequence Information.Target Organism: Gram-positive bacteria:Propionibacterium acnes ATCC 11827 and 33179 (MIC=2 µg/ml), Staphylococcus epidermidi (MIC=2-4 µg/ml), Streptococcus pyogenes (MIC=4 µg/ml), Enterococcus faecium (MIC=4-8 µg/ml), Staphylococcus aureus ATCC 29213 (MIC=8 µg/ml), Clostridium perfringens ATCC 9081 and 13124 (MIC=4-32 µg/ml), Enterococcus faecalis (MIC=32 µg/ml);Gram-negative bacteria:Bacteroides spp. ATCC 29771, 43935, 12290 (MIC=0.5-4 µg/ml), Shigella sonnei (MIC=2-4 µg/ml), Xanthomonas maltophilia (MIC=2-8 µg/ml), Salmonella Group B (MIC=4-8 µg/ml), Pseudomonas aeruginosa ATCC 27853 (MIC=8 µg/ml), Acinetobacter baumannii (MIC=8-16 µg/ml), Escherichia coli ATCC 25922 (MIC=8 µg/ml), Enterobacter aerogenes (MIC=8-16 µg/ml), Enterobacter cloacae (MIC=8-16 µg/ml), Klebsiella pneumoniae (MIC=8-16 µg/ml).
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: No hemolysis information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Comments: No comments found on DRAMP database

Literature.Title: Hagfish intestinal antimicrobial peptides are ancient cathelicidins.
Literature.Author: Uzzell T, Stolzenberg ED, Shinnar AE, Zasloff M.
